Physical Exam: General physical examination including vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature)
Justification: To assess the overall health status and identify any potential issues that may affect the pregnancy.

Physical Exam: Abdominal examination to assess for uterine size and tenderness
Justification: To evaluate the progress of the pregnancy and check for any abnormalities.

Physical Exam: Breast examination to check for tenderness and any abnormalities
Justification: To assess changes in breast tissue that may occur during pregnancy.

Physical Exam: Pelvic examination if indicated, to assess the cervix and any signs of complications
Justification: To evaluate the health of the reproductive organs and check for any potential issues.
To determine if the patient is within a healthy weight range for pregnancy.
